title: Electric force - 3 charged objects A B C on x-axis

content.description: Three small charged spheres, <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, and <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>, are placed along the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"> <mi>x</mi> </math>-axis at the positions shown in the figure. Spheres <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> have the same charge <math alttext="uppercase Q" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi></math>, while Sphere <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> has an unknown charge.
content.question: If the net electrostatic force on Sphere <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> due to spheres <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi> </math> is zero, what is the magnitude of the net electrostatic force on Sphere <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> due to spheres <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> and <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="five ninths times, the fraction with numerator k times uppercase Q squared, and denominator d squared" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>5</mn><mn>9</mn></mfrac><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi><msup><mi>Q</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="13 over 9 times, the fraction with numerator k times uppercase Q squared, and denominator d squared" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>13</mn><mn>9</mn></mfrac><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi><msup><mi>Q</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="five thirds times, the fraction with numerator k times uppercase Q squared, and denominator d squared" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>5</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi><msup><mi>Q</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="13 over 9 times, the fraction with numerator k times uppercase Q squared, and denominator d squared" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>13</mn><mn>9</mn></mfrac><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi><msup><mi>Q</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
